intro: Rhexia lychnitis, commonly known as the candleflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Rhexia lychnitis is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
